result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Courtney Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark A Courtney Jr in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Mark A Courtney Jr.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mark A Courtney in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Parties are pursuing a DPA resolution, requesting an additional status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Mark A Courtney in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Flynn has not received discovery or an offer and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties..  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms during the pendency of the case.

Defendant Mark A Courtney in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/07/2022@2p
